title: How to Permanently Delete an OnlyFans Account

steps.title: Unsubscribe to all subscriptions.
steps.content: Unsubscribe to all subscriptions. Before you delete your account, you will want to unsubscribe to any subscriptions that are currently active. Otherwise, your subscriptions may renew automatically when they expire and you may get charged for a subscription you are no longer using. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Go to the OnlyFans website and log in.
steps.content: Go to the OnlyFans website and log in. There is no official OnlyFans app. You must log in using a web browser. Go to OnlyFans.com in any web browser on PC, Mac, or on your smartphone. [2] X Research source If you are not logged into OnlyFans, log in with the email address and password associated with your account.

steps.title: Tap the Profile icon or click My Profile.
steps.content: Tap the Profile icon or click My Profile . If you are on your mobile device, tap the circle icon with your profile picture in the lower-right corner. If you are on a PC or Mac, click My Profile in the menu to the left.

steps.title: Click Edit Profile or tap Settings.
steps.content: Click Edit Profile or tap Settings . If you are on a mobile phone, tap Settings in the profile menu. If you are on a PC or Mac, click Edit Profile at the top of the page. In both cases, it is next to an icon that resembles a gear.

steps.title: Click or tap Account.
steps.content: Click or tap Account . On both mobile web browsers and PC or Mac, the Account option is the second option in the Settings menu.

steps.title: Click or tap Delete Account.
steps.content: Click or tap Delete Account . It is the last option at the bottom of the Account menu.

steps.title: Enter the verification code.
steps.content: Enter the verification code. You should see a 4-digit verification code in a colored box at the top. Enter the exact 4 digits you see in the box labeled "Verification Code." If you can't read the verification code, click or tap Reload code to display a different code.

steps.title: Click or tap Delete Account.
steps.content: Click or tap Delete Account . It's the red text below the box where you enter the verification code. This will permanently delete your account. You will not be able to reactivate or recover your account once it is deleted.

steps.title: Understand what happens when you delete your account.
steps.content: Understand what happens when you delete your account. As a creator, you may have some active subscriptions when you decide to delete your account. Your account will be disabled until the last active subscription expires. While your account is disabled, you will not be able to gain any new subscribers, but existing subscribers can still access your content. Once the last active subscription expires, your account will be permanently deleted. Once your account is permanently deleted, you cannot reactivate or recover your account or any of the content you posted. It is recommended that you save any pictures, videos, or live streams that are posted to your account. If you are thinking about starting a new account at some point, you may want to save a list of your subscribers.

If you are not logged into OnlyFans, log in with the email address and password associated with your account.

steps.title: Click or tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Click or tap your profile icon. It's the round image with your profile picture. On mobile devices, it's in the lower-right corner. On PC and Mac, it's in the upper-left corner above the menu to the left.

steps.title: Click or tap Following.
steps.content: Click or tap Following . It's the second option below your username in the menu that appears when you click or tap your profile icon. This displays a list of all the accounts you subscribe to.

steps.title: Click or tap Subscribed below an account you want to unsubscribe to.
steps.content: Click or tap Subscribed below an account you want to unsubscribe to. This will display a menu that allows you to unsubscribe.

steps.title: Select a reason for unsubscribing (optional).
steps.content: Select a reason for unsubscribing (optional). If you want, you can use the drop-down menu to select a reason why you are canceling your subscription. If you do not want to give a reason, you can leave it as "No specific reason."

steps.title: Click or tap Unsubscribe.
steps.content: Click or tap Unsubscribe . It's at the bottom of the subscription pop-up window. This will cancel your subscription when it expires. Your subscription will not auto-renew. [5] X Research source
